item.description:
LOCATION: MIT, Kresge Auditorium
Opposite 77 Massachusetts Avenue, Cambridge
AUDIO LINK: http://vimeo.com/1340...
BUY TICKETS: http://www.aidevents....
BIHAG SECTION : $100 (Dinner with Artists)
YAMAN SECTION : $ 70 (CD)
MARVA SECTION : $ 50
BHAIRAVI SECTION: $30 (General)
BHAIRAVI SECTION: $20 (Student - w/ Student ID at door)
CHILDREN UNDER 10: Free
** TICKET PRICES will go up as the date approaches, watch out for latest prices on the website**
******************************************************


ABOUT PANDIT HARIPRASAD CHAURASIA:
Pandit Hariprasad Chaurasia, the internationally renowned exponent of the bansuri or bamboo flute,
has become one of India's most-respected classical musicians. He has earned several awards, including the National Award of the Sangeet Natak Academy, which he won in 1984. In 1992, he was awarded the Padma Bhushan and the Konarak Samman and in 1994, he was bestowed the Yash Bharati Sanman. He has collaborated with several western musicians, including John McLaughlin and Jan Gabarek, and has also composed music for a number of Indian films. He has performed throughout the world winning acclaim from varied audiences and fellow musicians including Yehudi Menuhin and Jean Pierre Rampal.

ALL PROCEEDS SUPPORT OUR SUSTAINABLE DEVELOPMENTAL PROJECTS IN INDIA.


MORE DETAILS: www.aidevents.org
ABOUT AID: www.aidboston.org or www.aidindia.org
item.name: An Evening with Pandit Hariprasad Chaurasia in Boston
